SENT.plain: There are limited case reports of structural lesions causing Korsakoff syndrome
This report describes acute Korsakoff syndrome following localized, bilateral infarction of the mammillothalamic tracts (MTTs)
Axial T2-weighted imaging revealed the lesions at the lateral wall level of the third ventricle and diffusion-weighted imaging confirmed that the left lesion was new and the right old
Korsakoff syndrome persisted 6 months after the onset
This case suggests that bilateral MTT dysfunction can lead to Korsakoff syndrome
